title: Generate frontend-only VidyaMitra with readable JSX components and voice-based mock interview

requirements.text: Generate only frontend code without backend implementation
acceptanceCriteria: No backend Motoko files are generated
Frontend can run independently with mock data

requirements.text: Write all components using JSX format instead of TSX, ensuring readable and well-commented code suitable for beginners

quotes: make the code readable also and components in jsx

acceptanceCriteria: All React components use .jsx file extension
Code includes clear comments explaining functionality
Variable and function names are descriptive
Component logic is simple and easy to follow

requirements.text: Implement mock interview module as voice-based rather than text-based, with audio recording and playback capabilities
acceptanceCriteria: Mock interview page includes microphone recording functionality
User can record voice responses to interview questions
Audio playback is available for reviewing responses
Clear UI indicators for recording state (recording, paused, stopped)

requirements.text: Create email-based OTP authentication with login and register pages, redirecting to dashboard after successful login using protected routes

quotes: include email based otp verification during registration. after login user should be redirected to dashboard. use protected routes

acceptanceCriteria: Login page with email and OTP input fields exists
Register page includes email-based OTP verification flow
Successful authentication redirects to dashboard
Protected routes prevent unauthorized access to authenticated pages

requirements.text: Create dashboard layout with navbar, sidebar navigation, and main content area using plain CSS files (not Tailwind), with sidebar links for Dashboard, Resume, Roadmap, Quiz, and Progress pages

quotes: Create navbar sidebar and dashboard layout using css files not tailwind. sidebar should have links dashboard resume roadmap quiz progress

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard layout includes navbar component
Sidebar contains navigation links: Dashboard, Resume, Roadmap, Quiz, Progress
Layout styling uses plain CSS files only
Layout is responsive and clean

requirements.text: Create resume upload page with file input, upload button, success message display, and resume analysis result placeholder section

quotes: Create resume upload page with file upload input and upload button. show success message after upload. create resume analysis result section placeholder

acceptanceCriteria: Resume page includes file input for uploading resumes
Upload button triggers file upload action
Success message displays after successful upload
Placeholder section exists for resume analysis results

requirements.text: Create job role roadmap page where user enters job role and generates roadmap with topics, subtopics, and completion status (not started, in progress, completed), with progress saved in localStorage

quotes: Create page where user enters job role and clicks generate roadmap. show roadmap topics and subtopics in a list. each topic should have status not started in progress completed. progress should be saved in local storage

acceptanceCriteria: Roadmap page includes input field for job role and generate button
Generated roadmap displays topics and subtopics in list format
Each topic shows status: 'not started', 'in progress', or 'completed'
Progress persists using localStorage

requirements.text: Create topic quiz module where user enters topic, starts test with dummy questions, marks answers, and receives score

quotes: User enters topic and clicks start test. generate dummy questions list. allow marking answers and show score

acceptanceCriteria: Quiz page includes topic input field and start test button
Dummy questions list is generated and displayed
User can select answers for each question
Final score is calculated and displayed after completion

requirements.text: Create progress page showing roadmap completion percentage, number of quizzes taken, and last activity, fetching data from localStorage

quotes: Show roadmap completion percentage number of quizzes taken and last activity. fetch data from local storage

acceptanceCriteria: Progress page displays roadmap completion as percentage
Number of completed quizzes is shown
Last activity timestamp is displayed
All data is retrieved from localStorage

requirements.text: Use the specified custom color palette consistently throughout the application: primary deep blue #1e3a8a, secondary sky blue #38bdf8, accent green #22c55e, background light gray #f8fafc, text dark slate #0f172a

quotes: Use this color palette in the design primary deep blue #1e3a8a secondary sky blue #38bdf8 accent green #22c55e background light gray #f8fafc text dark slate #0f172a

acceptanceCriteria: CSS uses #1e3a8a for primary color
CSS uses #38bdf8 for secondary color
CSS uses #22c55e for accent color
CSS uses #f8fafc for background color
CSS uses #0f172a for text color
Color usage is consistent across all pages and components

requirements.text: Organize frontend with clean folder structure: components, pages, services, routes, context, and styles directories, with reusable navbar, sidebar, and API service files

quotes: keep folder structure components pages services routes context styles. create reusable navbar sidebar and api service files

acceptanceCriteria: Frontend has organized folders: components, pages, services, routes, context, styles
Navbar component is reusable across pages
Sidebar component is reusable across pages
API service file exists for centralized API calls
Structure follows beginner-friendly conventions

constraints: Do not generate backend Motoko code
Use plain CSS files only, not Tailwind CSS
Keep components small and easy to understand
Use React hooks only, no complex state management libraries
Simulate backend with localStorage for persistence
